reviewText: This review is for the season, not the dvd package. This season seemed to go off track from the great first season. While it is still superior to most of the teen dramas on the air today, a lot of things didn't work for me in season 2.Of all the new characters (and there were quite a few) only Felix really worked - until they ruined his character toward the end. The other new characters were pretty much a yawn fest, including Felix's dull sister. Felix had great chemistry with Brooke and really brought out a lot of intensity to some of the other characters. He had real potential of becoming a very complex character for many years to come.Speaking of Brooke, boy, did they ruin her character. She was a fun, edgy character who, unrealistically, transformed into a dull, responsible cliche. And what happened to the Lucas/Peyton romance. Just because the actors that portray Lucas and Brooke are married doesn't mean that their characters should hook up on the show. Let's explore Lucas and Peyton some more.My two favorite relationships of the series - Nathan/Hayley and Nathan/Lucas were sacrificed this season for very poor stories. The brotherly relationship is the heart and soul of the show, while Hayley was completely written out of character. Who knew that Nathan would turn out to be the mature one in that relationship?As for the adults, where was Whitey for most of the season? Or for that matter, the basketball team and high school??? The new relationships for Keith and Karen didn't work. And Nathan's mother did a complete 180 with her personality. Only the wicked Dan really was really worth watching. He's the new JR Ewing.On positive notes, the actress that plays Peyton did some incredible work this season. Also, it did look as if the show was heading back to the right direction with the last few episodes of this season. Nathan's 'what if' dream was classic.Regardless, I will still buy this season because I love this show. Here's hoping that season 3 gets back on track.
summary: Did this season go off track from season 1?

reviewText: The second season of ONE TREE HILL found the Tree Hill residents facing a number of problems. Dan who was recovering from his heart attack planed the ultimate revenge on his brother Keith who slept with his wife Deb. Peyton dealt with a number of blows and even turned to drugs, only to be reunited with Jake and to find love with him, even if just for a little while. Two newcomers Felix and Anna joined the fold and shook things up in Tree Hill with Brooke and Lucas respectively. Lucas made the ultimate sacrifice to protect the ones he loves. Karen found love with her professor. Nathan had to deal with the crushing blow that his new wife Haley chose to put her music career ahead of their marriage. Deb struggled with her drug addiction and her desire to leave Dan.Just a brief and general overview of this season. You have to watch it to really enjoy the plots. They moved even quicker this season, but it was enjoyable nonetheless. I couldn't stop watching, until I was done. The writing is excellent on this show, and the character development still as strong as last season. Great cast, great plot and character development, and entertaining. What more do you want from a TV show??
Title: N/A

reviewText: Season 2 was great; it showed Nathan and Haley deal with being married in High School, Lucas focusing more on his relationship with Dan rather than Peyton and Brooke, and Keith meeting Jules.  Brooke loses her parents' money and Peyton goes through her victim dramas as usual.  Deb and Dan always make this show interesting and funny; especially Dan.  When re-watching this show you can really see how week after week his character gets more and more wicked and lays the groundwork for what he does in season 3.  The last episode was perfect; the music the character's relationships, everything had built up to this moment and it was executed perfectly,  Must have for fans of the show.
summary: One of the Best Seasons of this Show

reviewText: The second season, was quite suprising fresh approach next to no basketball, which was probably about the only downer.The interaction between the leads got better and better.  Dan Scott has to be the new JR Ewing if there ever was one!  That is one mean man but blimey never the less well acted.Missed the Karen/Keith relationship a lot but the following through and spreading the wings of each character was awesome.  Jake is great!However the two main leads again stole the show in equal measure Chad has simply grown in stature and charisma while the young James Lafferty gave every emotion possible.  The later half of the season had some great stand alone episodes, that alone made it worth the buy & the swapping of roles between Nathen and Lucas in the switch episode worked amazingly well.I also hope Hayley and Nathen make it as they are such a great couple and I wish the third season was out.  The music, the growth of the characters and that this outdoes the oc etc ten to one and that this show is so rich in talent.Superb and though the change of direction at start was off putting this show knows how to aim and to bring even more of its writers and cast.Keep it up & One Tree Hill is a hit in every essence of the word.  Like the 1st it is a dvd worth having & the range of emotions is amazing.
summary: Interesting and ended with a bang
